Let the wise one control his thoughts, for they are difficult to perceive, often elusive, and they rush about frantically: a mind well controlled achieves peace and happiness.

What we are today comes from our thoughts of yesterday, and our present thoughts build our life of tomorrow: our life is the creation of our mind. If a man speaks or acts with an impure mind, suffering will follow him as the wheel of the cart follows the beast that draws the cart. Dependent Origination is the teaching (that life) is not the mere play of blind chance, but has an existence that is dependent upon conditions. That, precisely with the removal of these conditions, those things that have arisen in dependence upon them-thus also all suffering-must perforce disappear and cease to be.
Goodwill toward all beings is the true religion; cherish in your hearts boundless goodwill to all that lives.

When a man is stimulated by his own thoughts, full of desire and dwelling on what is attractive, his craving increases even more. He is making the fetter even stronger. But he who takes pleasure in stilling his thoughts, practising the contemplation of what is repulsive, and remaining recollected, now he will make an end of craving, he will snap the bonds of Mara. His aim is accomplished, he is without fear, rid of craving and without stain. He has removed the arrows of changing existence. This is his last body.
A tree is a wonderful living organism which gives shelter, food, warmth and protection to all living things. It even gives shade to those who wield an axe to cut it down
Your enemy can be your greatest teacher.

Truths cannot be acquired from words out of other people's mouths. Before Truths can be internalized, they must come from one's own realizations and practices. Through a lifetime of personal practice, human beings are capable of revealing all of the secrets of the cosmic essence. You are your own best judge.
In every trial Let understanding fight for you.
Wherever you live is your temple, if you treat it like one.

Surely if living creatures saw the results of all their evil deeds, they would turn away from them in disgust. But selfhood blinds them, and they cling to their obnoxious desires. They crave pleasure for themselves and they cause pain to others; when death destroys their individuality, they find no peace; their thirst for existence abides and their selfhood reappears in new births. Thus they continue to move in the coil and can find no escape from the hell of their own making.
Love is a fleeting emotion, to reach true nirvana one must know themselves and forsake love, for it breeds contempt

When you come upon a path
 that brings benefit 
 and happiness to all,
 follow this course
 as the moon
 journeys through the stars.
More than those who hate you, more than all your enemies, an undisciplined mind does greater harm.
We are formed and molded by our thoughts. Those whose minds are shaped by selfless thoughts give joy when they speak or act.

Peace comes from within. Do not seek it without. It can be argued that peace and happiness comes from the subjective internalised perspective of realizing things could be worse and being grateful they aren't. The alternative view that peace and happiness comes from the objective external perspective of having more and better things than at present, while important for growth, can be a never-ending source of jealousy, dissatisfaction and disappointment. A balance of the two, where people are grateful for what they have while striving for more seems the best blended perspective.
Life is dear to all beings, they have the right to live the same that we do.
The mind contains all possibilities.

The judgment: You are now before Yama, King of the Dead. In vain will you try to...deny or conceal the evil deeds you have done. ... the mirror in which Yama seems to read your past is your own memory, and also his judgment is your own. It is you yourself who pronounce your own judgment.
Drop by drop is the water pot filled. Likewise, the wise man, gathering it little by little, fills himself with good.
Remember that the only constant in life is change.

If we fail to look after others when they need help, who will look after us?

Your days pass like rainbows, like a flash of lightning, like a star at dawn. Your life is short. How can you quarrel?
Believe only what you yourself test and judge to be true.
Why cling to the pain and the wrongs of yesterday?  Why hold on to the very things that keep you from hope and love.
You should respect each other and refrain from disputes; you should not, like water and oil, repel each other, but should, like milk and water, mingle together.
"Existence is sorrow." Understand, and go beyond sorrow. This is the way of brightness.

Learn this from the waters: in mountain clefts and chasms, loud gush the streamlets, but great rivers flow silently.
He who experiences the unity of life sees his own self in all beings.

Journey over, sorrowless, freed in every way, and with all bonds broken - for such a man there is no more distress.
Even if everyone elseIs not doing good,I alone will.Even if everyone elseis doing wrong,I alone will not.
All tremble at violence; all fear death. Putting oneself in the place of another, one should not kill nor cause another to kill.
The world is afflicted by death and decay. But the wise do not grieve, having realized the nature of the world.

The Tempter masters the lazy and irresolute man who dwells on the attractive side of things, ungoverned in his senses, and unrestrained in his food, like the wind overcomes a rotten tree. But the Tempter cannot master a man who dwells on the distasteful side of things, self-controlled in his senses, moderate in eating, resolute and full of faith, like the wind cannot move a mountain crag.
The heavens and the earth may be captured by the mind's eye.
Speak or act with a pure mind, and happiness will follow you as your shadow, unshakable.
The greatest action is not conforming with the worlds ways.
Learn to ne happy with what you have.

The one who wanders independent in the world, free from opinions and viewpoints, does not grasp them and enter into disputations and arguments. As the lotus rises on its stalk unsoiled by the mud and the water, so the wise one speaks of peace and is unstained by the opinions of the world.
Have compassion for all beings, rich and poor alike; each has their suffering. Some suffer too much, others too little.
Friendship is the only cure for hatred, the only guarantee of peace.

If it is not truthful and not helpful, don't say it. If it is truthful and not helpful, don't say it. If it is not truthful and helpful, don't say it. If it is truthful and helpful, wait for the right time.

Whatever a person frequently thinks and reflects on, that will become the inclination of their mind.

All beings tremble before violence. All love life. All fear death. See yourself in others. Then whom can you hurt? What harm can you do?
Better than a thousand hollow words Is one word that brings peace. Better than a thousand hollow verses Is one verse that brings peace.
When one sees that everything exists as an illusion, one can live in a higher sphere than ordinary man.
We are the same as plants, as trees, as other people, as the rain that falls. We consist of that which is around us, we are the same as everything.
There is a way to be purified, to overcome sorrows and grief, to release suffering, to secure the right path to realize nirvana. This is to be mindful.
Religion is a cow. It gives milk, but it also kicks.

May I hold myself in compassion.
May I meet the suffering and ignorance of others with compassion.

It drags one down, and loose as it feels, it is hard to break. Breaking this fetter, people renounce the world, free from longing and abandoning sensuality.

This is how to contemplate our conditioned existence in this fleeting world: 
 
 Like a tiny drop of dew, or a bubble floating in a stream; 
 Like a flash of lightning in a summer cloud, 
 Or a flickering lamp, an illusion, a phantom, or a dream. 
 
 So is all conditioned existence to be seen.

How does one stay mindful? Where feelings are known as they arise, known as they persist, known as they pass away. Thoughts are known as they arise, known as they persist, known as they pass away. Perceptions are known they arise, known as they persist, known as they pass away. This is how a monk stays awake.

Radiate boundless love towards the entire world - above, below, and across - unhindered, without ill will, without enmity.
The fool is his own enemy. Seeking wealth, he destroys himself. Seek rather the other shore.

Even if a fool lived with a wise man all his life, he would still not recognise the truth, like a wooden spoon cannot recognise the flavour of the soup.

There is no fire like greed, No crime like hatred, No sorrow like separation, No sickness like hunger of heart, And no joy like the joy of freedom.  Health, contentment and trust Are your greatest possessions, And freedom your greatest joy.  Look within. Be still. Free from fear and attachment, Know the sweet joy of living in the way.

If you sleep, Desire grows in you Like a vine in the forest. Like a monkey in the forest You jump from tree to tree, Never finding the fruit - From life to life, Never finding peace. If you are filled with desire Your sorrows swell Like the grass after the rain. But if you subdue desire Your sorrows shall fall from you Like drops of water from a lotus flower.
Be the witness of your thoughts.
Be a lamp unto yourselves! Work out your liberation with diligence! Fill your mind with compassion!
Flower and thorn are in the same stem.
With his mind free from the inflow of thoughts and from restlessness, by abandoning both good and evil, an alert man knows no fear.
If dresses would have qualified people, then whores would have ruled the world.

You too shall pass away. Knowing this, how can you quarrel?
No matter what path you choose, really walk it.
It is good to have companions when occasion arises, and it is good to be contented with whatever comes.

Just as treasures are uncovered from the earth, so virtue appears from good deeds, and wisdom appears from a pure and peaceful mind. To walk safely through the maze of human life, one needs the light of wisdom and the guidance of virtue.
Kindnessis giving others happiness.Compassionis removing others' bitterness.Joyis freeing others from suffering.
Winning gives birth to hostility Losing, one lies down in pain. The calmed lie down with ease, having set winning and losing aside.
Consider Others as Yourself.
Concentrate the mind on the present moment.

Moved by their selfish desires, people seek after fame and glory. But when they have acquired it, they are already stricken in years. If you hanker after worldly fame and practise not the Way, your labors are wrongfully applied and your energy is wasted. It is like unto burning an incense stick. However much its pleasing odor be admired, the fire that consumes is steadily burning up the stick.
Suffering does not befall him who is without attachment to names and forms.
See the truth, and you will see me.

If a man who has committed many a misdemeanor does not repent and cleanse his heart of the evil, retribution will come upon his person as sure as the streams run into the ocean which becomes ever deeper and wider. If a man who has committed a misdemeanor come to the knowledge of it, reform himself, and practise goodness, the force of retribution will gradually exhaust itself as a disease gradually loses its baneful influence when the patient perspires.

What is evil? Killing is evil, lying is evil, slandering is evil, abuse is evil, gossip is evil, envy is evil, hatred is evil, to cling to false doctrine is evil; all these things are evil. And what is the root of evil? Desire is the root of evil, illusion is the root of evil.
To force oneself to believe and to accept a thing without understanding is political, and not spiritual or intellectual.
Beware of the anger of the mouth. Master your words. Let them serve truth.
Will not be punished for your anger, your anger is the punishment.
If you hold yourself dear, protect yourself well.
If we can look upon our work not for self-benefit,but as a means to benefit society,we will be practicing appreciation and patience in our daily lives.

A family is a place where minds come in contact with one another. If these minds love one another the home will be as beautiful as a flower garden. But if these minds get out of harmony with one another it is like a storm that plays havoc with the garden.
If a string has one end, it has another.
The wise man makes an island of himself that no flood can overwhelm.
"All conditioned things are impermanent" - when one sees this with wisdom, one turns away from suffering.
Just as a picture is drawn by an artist, surroundings are created by the activities of the mind
The good renounce everything. The pure don't babble about sensual desires. Whether touched by pleasure or pain, the wise show no change of temper.
Everything changes, nothing remains without change.
In protecting oneself, others are protected; In protecting others, oneself is protected.
Only within our body, with its heart and mind, can bondage and suffering be found, and only here can we find true liberation.
Peace comes from within; do not try to seek it without.
Wherever a person goes, his deeds, like a shadow, will follow.
Resolutely train yourself to attain peace
He who, seeking his own happiness, punishes or kills beings who also long for happiness, will not find happiness after his death.
The cause of all pain and suffering is ignorance.
At the end of the way is freedom. Until then, patience.
We are what we think.
Once you know the nature of anger and joy is empty and you let them go, you free yourself from karma.
The mind is the source of happiness and unhappiness.
To insist on a spiritual practice that served you in the past is to carry the raft on your back after you have crossed the river.
Right perspective is no perspective or all perspectives.
It is your mind that creates the world.

Everything is based on mind, is led by mind, is fashioned by mind. If you speak and act with a polluted mind, suffering will follow you, as the wheels of the oxcart follow the footsteps of the ox. Everything is based on mind, is led by mind, is fashioned by mind. If you speak and act with a pure mind, happiness will follow you, as a shadow clings to a form.
By giving away food we get more strength. By bestowing clothing on others we gain more beauty. By donating abodes of purity and truth we acquire great treasures.

I reached in experience the nirvana which is unborn, unrivalled, secure from attachment, undecaying and unstained. This condition is indeed reached by me which is deep, difficult to see, difficult to understand, tranquil, excellent, beyond the reach of mere logic, subtle, and to be realized only by the wise.
Nothing is to be clung to as I, me or mine
If a man's mind becomes pure, his surroundings will also become pure.

People cleave to their worldly possessions and selfish passions so blindly as to sacrifice their own lives for them. They are like a child who tries to eat a little, honey smeared on the edge of a knife. The amount is by no means sufficient to appease his appetite, but he runs the risk of wounding his tongue.
He who is kind to animals heaven will protect.
Work out your own salvation. Do not depend on others.
It is not life and wealth and power that enslave men, but the cleaving to life and wealth and power.
Care about your children. Just bless them instead of worrying, as every child is the little Buddha who helps his parents to grow up.
When one feels no shame in telling a deliberate lie, there is no evil, I tell you, he will not do.
Happiness or sorrow- whatever befalls you, walk on untouched, unattached.
To abstain from lying is essentially wholesome.
Meditate. Live purely. Be quiet. Do your work with mastery. Like the moon, come out from behind the clouds! Shine.
Victory breeds hatred; the defeated live in pain. The peaceful live happily, giving up victory and defeat.
Suffering is temporary, enlightenment is forever.
Few among men are they who cross to the further shore. The others merely run up and down the bank on this side.
No light is brighter than wisdom. Wisdom is the light in the world.

For soon the body is discarded, Then what does it feel? A useless log of wood, it lies on the ground, Then what does it know? Your worst enemy cannot harm you As much as your own thoughts, unguarded. But once mastered, No one can help you as much, Not even your father or your mother.
Yet the Teaching is simple. Do what is right. Be pure. At the end of the way is freedom.
To become vegetarian is to step into the stream which leads to nirvana.
The greatest impurity is ignorance. Free yourself from it. Be pure.
One who is wise and disciplined, always kind and intelligent, humble and free from pride. One like this will be praised.
Don't pray for lighter burdens, but for stronger backs.
She who knows life flows, feels no wear or tear, needs no mending or repair.
Neither in the sky nor in mid-ocean, nor by entering into mountain clefts, nowhere in the world is there a place where one may escape from the results of evil deeds.

I have passed in ignorance through a cycle of many rebirths, seeking the builder of the house. Continuous rebirth is a painful thing. But now, housebuilder, I have found you out. Dispassion is the best of mental states. . . .

Do not say anything harsh: what you have said will be said back to you.
A person writing at night may put out the lamp, but the words he has written will remain. It is the same with the destiny we create for ourselves in this world.

There is no satisfying the senses, not even with a shower of money. "The senses are of slight pleasure and really suffering." When a wise man has realised this, he takes no pleasure, as a disciple of the Buddhas, even in the pleasures of heaven. Instead he takes pleasure in the elimination of craving.
Those who have failed to work toward the truth have missed the purpose of living.
Attachment leads to suffering.

First of all there will appear to you, swifter than lightning, the luminous splendor of the colorless light of Emptiness, and that will surround you on all sides. ...Try to submerge yourself in that light, giving up all belief in a separate self, all attachment to your illusory ego.
There is no fire like passion. There are no chains like hate. Illusion is a net, Desire is a rushing river.
Delight in meditation and solitude.  Compose yourself, be happy.  You are a seeker.
Don't just do something, be there.

In exactly the same way, ... scatter your body, your feeling, your perception, your predispositions, your discriminative consciousness, break them up, knock them down, cease to play with them, apply yourself to the destruction of craving for them. Verily, ... the extinction of craving is Nirvana.
Love yourself and watch - Today, tomorrow, always. To straighten the crooked You must first do a harder thing - Straighten yourself.
Love and serve the world through your work.
Whatever is subject to origination is all subject to cessation.
War ends only when people love each other.

We living beings, right down to crickets, ants, mosquitoes , and flies, all possess life that is without beginning or end.

All living beings have Buddha nature and can become Buddhas.
Things are not what they appear to be: nor are they otherwise.
How deeply did you learn to let go?

It is wrong to think that misfortunes come from the east or from the west; they originate within one's own mind.

Do not pursue the past. Do not lose yourself in the future. The past no longer is. The future has not yet come. Looking deeply at life as it is. In the very here and now, the practitioner dwells in stability and freedom. We must be diligent today. To wait until tomorrow is too late. Death comes unexpectedly. How can we bargain with it? The sage calls a person who knows how to dwell in mindfulness night and day, 'one who knows the better way to live alone.'
Your suffering is my suffering and your happiness is my happiness.
Being generous, just helping one's relatives and being blameless in one's actions; this is the best good luck.
Let him the intelligent man  admonish, let him teach, let him forbid what is improper ! - he will be beloved of the good, by the bad he will be hated.

Just as a rock of one solid mass remains unshaken by the wind, even so, neither forms, nor sounds, nor odors, nor tastes, nor contacts of any kind, neither the desired, nor the undesired, can cause such an one to waver. Even death is not to be feared by one who has lived wisely.
Through effort you will cross any raging flood, through energy you will pass any sorrow.
All compounded things are subject to decay. Strive with diligence!
Should a person do good, let him do it again and again. Let him find pleasure therein, for blissful is the accumulation of good.
Don't keep searching for the truth, just let go of your opinions.
Unity can only be manifested by the Binary. Unity itself and the idea of Unity are already two.
Let us live most happily, free from hatred in the midst of the hateful; Let us remain free from hatred in the midst of people who hate.
Better than a long speech is a single quietening word.
One who previously made bad karma, but who reforms and creates good karma, brightens the world like the moon appearing from behind a cloud.

If you are tossed about by doubts, full of strong thoughtless passions, and yearning only for that which is detrimental, your thirst will grow stronger and stronger, unquenched, and your pain will grow with your defilements.
Like a lovely flower full of color but lacking in fragrance, are the words of those who do not practice what they teach.
I am always at the beginning.
Even loss and betrayal can bring us awakening.

This existence of ours is as transient as autumn clouds To watch the birth and death of beings is like looking at the movements of a dance. A lifetime is like a flash of lightning in the sky, Rushing by, like a torrent down a steep mountain.
It is better to do nothing Than to do what is wrong. For whatever you do, you do to yourself.

Let all-embracing thoughts for all beings be yours.
